name: Taj Campton Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night on August 5, 2011. We pulled up and immediately, the doorman (who was incredibly friendly and helpful) helped us with our bags to the hotel. When we asked about a nearby parking garage (given the steep $50 overnight valet parking fee), he directed us to a garage literally up the street (Sutter Stockton Garage), which offers overnight parking for $26. So I would recommend dropping off any luggage at the hotel first, and then parking the car at the garage. The front desk was efficient and friendly, and offered us free bottled water upon check out (for our walk to the Giants-Phillies game!) They also let us store our bags there after checkout, which we picked up on returning from the game and picking up our car from the garage.
reviews.title: Quiet oasis in the City

reviews.text: We went to a Giants-Phillies game the next day and walked there (about 15-20 minute walk) with easy directions from the doorman (I wish I remembered his name!) You are in Union Square so there is plenty to do - lots of restaurants, close to Chinatown, and tons of shopping.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.text: The elevators are currently being renovated at the hotel so be prepared for somewhat longer waiting times than you may expect. I booked through Expedia and paid about $238 for the room (California Room with King Bed). The room had a comfortable king sized bed, one nightstand, a desk (next to the bed) with chair, an armchair, and combination TV stand (with flatscreen TV) and minibar. The minibar had a nespresso machine with good espresso "pods", two bottles of water (I think one is complimentary), snacks (potato chips, nuts, etc.) and minifridge with various juices, sodas, alcoholic beverages, etc. The linens were soft and good quality and the room was pleasantly furnished and decorated, albeit a bit small (but comfortable). The bathroom door was a frosted glass and wood sliding door, the bathroom itself was spacious and tastefully done. The shower had excellent water pressure, and the Molten Brown toiletries were great. There is also a nice "closet" wall with shelves, a safe, etc. on the opposite side of the bathroom. The room was very quiet except during the afternoon on the first day, when there was a protest/demonstration going on the next block over. They offer a choice of complimentary newspapers, delivered to your room in the morning (we opted for the NYT).
reviews.title: Baloney on Service

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Hotel Diva, and the Hotel California (next to Millenium restaurant) and would choose the Taj Compton again and over those other hotels. The service was fantastic and everyone was quietly competent and incredibly helpful. The hotel is on the smaller size and a lovely oasis in the city and ideally situated for many activities!
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel in San Francisco
A step back to the "old days" when the customer was treated like gold
reviews.text: We also stayed the following three nights at Cavallo Point outside of Sausalito if you want to check out that review as well!

Looks can be deceiving. The exterior & the rooms of this venerable old hotel are plain, but the service and maintenance were flawless. From doorman to concierge to women on the front desk, everyone knew me instantly. Location can't be beat--half block from Union Square. Michelin-starred restaurant one of the best in city; bar/bistro great for lunch, light evening meal, drinks. With 3rd-night free promotion, price was excellent for location and service. Not a single complaint. Taj has cleverly updated the building. Think sophisticated Asian minimalist.
reviews.title: 5-star personalized service; great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely loved this hotel! The rooms was beautiful and the bathroom had a seperate shower and a large bath tub. You really have to try the breakfast. It is beautiful and delicious! The service was also excellent. The location is perfect as well. You are in the middle of the city and can walk everywhere. We had a rental car which we parked around the corner to a parking house. The concierge helped to find a place where to eat and what to do in the city as well. Would stay there again any time!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: I loved the Taj hotel! Its just a few steps away from busy Union Square, yet its so quiet and peaceful! The hotel is GORGEOUS! Rooms are beautiful, and room service is amazing. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful; from the door man to the receptionist to the maids! Oh yes, I would definitely go back. Would also recommend it for couples or friends. Its a great place to retire after a hectic day of shopping and sight seeing. They don't have a traditional English breafast like we do at home but theyir chips/ french fries are to die for!! Overall FABULOUS experience!
reviews.title: So Beautiful, So Classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrrived at the Taj after a very long flight and we were delighted with the prompt and efficient check-in. Our room was meant to be a deluxe room and initally when I went in to the room I was disappointed with it, it was very small and I wonder what a standard room is like if this is deluxe - in fact I actually think it was a standard room but they told us it was a deluxe as were we entitled to an up-grade as we were staying for 3 nights. That said, the room actully grew on me! It was very comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with molton brown products.
reviews.title: Really Lovely

reviews.text: We ate in the bar on the first night as we were too exhausted to do much exploring - the the food and cocktails were really lovely. The location of the hotel is fantastic, steps from Union Square.
reviews.title: A very intimate experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed there at the start of our honeymoon and it was perfect. Excellent location just off Union Sq. A lady called Honeylyn (spelling? Sorry!) welcomed us as we arrived and was a pleasure to deal with throughout our stay. She was unable to upgrade our room but did send a complimentary bottle of champagne to our room along with some chocolates. This was a very nice surprise. I'd also compliment the concierge. He organised baseball tickets for us at short notice.
reviews.title: Amazing Central Hotel - staff were excellent

reviews.text: I selected a hotel via Expedia and ended up at Taj Campton Place, a small, wonderful boutiquey spot. I lucked out. My room (#206) was spotless and well appointed with lots of little quality touches. The location of the hotel is great, right off Union Square. The service is every bit as strong or stronger than the Four Seasons. They always said hello and goodbye using my name as I'd walk past the front desk. The restaurant was also top notch (I ate my breakfasts there). I don't know....it was just one of those rare moments when you end up in a place that you don't know and it turns out to be awesome. I'm taking my wife back to San Fran for my birthday week this October and will stay there. That's how much I liked it.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, one other thing....the gym is indoors/outdoors. They open up the sides of tenting around the treadmills and so you're jogging away, outdoors, on the roof. It's really cool.
reviews.title: Refined and Relaxed

reviews.text: Great location, attentive staff, and great amenities.
reviews.title: My home in San Francisco

reviews.text: Again, my stay at Campton Place met all my expectations.
reviews.title: Service, Service, Service

reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed three nights in the Taj. Excellent location for Union Square and the surrounding shopping and restaurants. The room was fine, but not as large as some we experienced. Clean, tidy and good service.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would return to the Taj again and again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The Taj is extremely well located just off Time Square and as one of the newest hotels in the area it is well decorated and has very comfortable rooms which are overall quiet and the beds are very comfortable.
reviews.title: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly

reviews.text: Toiletries are not skipped on (Molten and Brown) and the rooms are a good size.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Elegant and Quiet

reviews.text: Breakfast is a little expensive (SF is such a foodie city, eat out.) But the service is outstanding, from the check-in staff to the concierge it is a fabulous team at the hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous location and service!

aka: Taj Campton Place Hotel San Francisco
description: Taj Campton Place is the quintessential landmark San Francisco Hotel on Union Square. It’s located just steps away from the City’s best shopping, dining and nightlife. Award-winning Campton Place Restaurant and Bar one of the City’s most revered dining destinations. Executive Chef Srijith’s cuisine with renowned Master Sommelier Richard Dean’s wine cellar combined to create an unparalleled culinary extravaganza. Campton Place’s superb location, elegant guestrooms, extraordinary service, outstanding amenities make it San Francisco’s ideal home away from home.
